p: With the program package Statistica (version 12, Tulsa, OK, United States) an analysis of variance (ANOVA) was conducted. Tukey HSD (honestly significant difference) was performed at p ≤ 0.05 to detect significant interactions between factors while taking into account the fact that multiple comparisons are necessary due to the experimental design. Lead and copper treatment was considered as single factor (except for Figure 1), respectively and each S. indica and R. irregularis inoculation was also considered as a single factor, respectively. For detailed information see Supplementary Tables S1– S9. If no significant interaction between all factors was observed, the mean values were compared pairwise at p ≤ 0.05 with Student’s t-Test. All data are shown as mean values with standard errors.
